body:
Well, Windows 10 is underway and it's Technical Preview is already released. I am with the Windows Insider Program and I am typing this with the new and beautiful Windows 10. All pictures have been taken by me. It has it's bugs and it's stripped from features currently, but I am going to show you wonderful features.

THE TASKBAR
Currently, it's not fully customisable, but here is a picture to get you to know what you will be expecting: http://i.gyazo.com/e9de25c5a66717a3c0e5b69b3b6fc53b.png

THE START BUTTON
I'm sure most of you loved the Start Button from Windows 7 and below; and finally, it is back. NEW AND IMPROVED: http://gyazo.com/589db61589dd90142c16b2b476eca101.png

THE WINDOW
The window borders are VERY SMALL and have changed by a lot: http://gyazo.com/7ed3b0aaa8eae97d72824d8e0817e792.png

GRID SNAPPING
One of my favourite features, so say you got 5 windows open and you really want to organise it. Look at this: http://gyazo.com/0b7523b27da5795bd53222dfee3ee7da.png
You can fit: MORE THEN 2 WINDOWS ON A SCREEN PERFECTLY.

COMING SOON: YOUTUBE VIDEO TO SHOW ALL THOUROUGH STUFF.

title: Windows 10 - Technical Preview

replies.body:
vsplesk101, more then NVIDIA is supported.

There will be much better touchscreen input, currently it's not really finished.

Windows 10 will be an optimal operating system for fluid gaming and everything will be supported.

Windows 8, Windows 7 apps are supported with Windows 10.

replies.body: For some reason, even though I am British, the US Time format is used. Eh can't complain.
replies.body_tagged: For some reason, even though I am British, the US Time format is used. Eh can't complain.

replies.body: I don't really like the placement of the search bar being on the taskbar, I like to pin a bunch of programs on there without having the up and down arrows for pages of them. Also, not really liking the new color for open browsers/windows (The minus, box and X symbol), I prefer the Windows 7/8 type. It's look decent overall though.
replies.body_tagged: I don't really like the placement of the search bar being on the taskbar, I like to pin a bunch of programs on there without having the up and down arrows for pages of them. Also, not really liking the new color for open browsers/windows (The minus, box and X symbol), I prefer the Windows 7/8 type. It's look decent overall though.

replies.body:
I know that you can customise soon, and unfortunately, the old preview of Windows 10 had the search bar, INSIDE the Windows Start Menu.

Also, as this is a Tech Preview, I can send suggestions and issues and feedback to Microsoft, so if you see something different, I'll send it to em.
